channel.title: Online server? need help, very detailed {teamviewer}
channel.description:
Ok im going to be very detailed what my problem is..
i cant make my ip/server online....idk why...
i portfoward with my linksys router and utorrent and none of them work...
i have no-ip, i followed all the steps every tut tells me...
i had ppl teamview it and couldent figure out the problem....
i added a new port in my firewall, i even disabled it..
me and other ppl cant figue it out....
here a list of steps i do so u can see...
[URL=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/849/help1v.png/][IMG]http://img849.imageshack.us/img849/1771/help1v.png[/img][/URL]
[URL=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/269/help2a.png/][IMG]http://img269.imageshack.us/img269/812/help2a.png[/img][/URL]
[URL=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/828/help3.png/][IMG]http://img828.imageshack.us/img828/1933/help3.png[/img][/URL]
[URL=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/143/help4u.png/][IMG]http://img143.imageshack.us/img143/5871/help4u.png[/img][/URL]
it cant be the source or client cuz when i dont put my ip or when i put vaild online ip it works...
[URL=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/5/help5x.png/][IMG]http://img5.imageshack.us/img5/6672/help5x.png[/img][/URL]
IM SO DESPERATE FOR HELP ILL LIETERALLY DO ANYTHING FOR WHO EVER CAN HELP ME GET THIS ONLINE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

item.title: Online server? need help, very detailed {teamviewer}
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

Some router’s cant portforward, my NetGear can’t. Google your router model and see if it can or not in the specification’s for it

Read full topic
item.source: Online server? need help, very detailed {teamviewer}

item.title: Online server? need help, very detailed {teamviewer}
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Just a thought, but most of the time it seems that you can’t connect to your own computer using your IP address. If you want to make sure the port is opened you can check at http://canyouseeme.org/

Read full topic
item.source: Online server? need help, very detailed {teamviewer}

item.title: Online server? need help, very detailed {teamviewer}
item.dc:creator: @Marine5287 Marine5287
item.description:
@Marine5287 wrote:

[quote=“oldschool-scape, post:2, topic:397747”]u dont have to do anything with that router.

oke so u open
1- No-ip Client (called something with DUC)
2- open that source
3- open utorrent
4- set port ( u already dit)
5- close source
6- open source
7- open client ( typ ur No-ip Host Ip)
8- and play

and i’ve always some problems with hosting on 43594 with utorrent for a reason
so i prefer port 5555

try that but make sure u set it in server and client to port 5555 to[/quote]

That’s one way.

@topic
Did you do the same in Port Range Forwarding as you did in Single Port Forwarding?

Read full topic
item.source: Online server? need help, very detailed {teamviewer}

item.title: Online server? need help, very detailed {teamviewer}
item.dc:creator: @oldschool-scape oldschool-scape
item.description:
@oldschool-scape wrote:

u dont have to do anything with that router.

oke so u open
1- No-ip Client (called something with DUC)
2- open that source
3- open utorrent
4- set port ( u already dit)
5- close source
6- open source
7- open client ( typ ur No-ip Host Ip)
8- and play

and i’ve always some problems with hosting on 43594 with utorrent for a reason
so i prefer port 5555

try that but make sure u set it in server and client to port 5555 to

Read full topic
